intro: Hypecoum aequilobum, commonly known as the white hellebore, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes罂粟 and other related genera. The plant produces showy, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are palmately lobed and have a rough, hairy texture. Hypecoum aequilobum is typically found in woodland areas and is known for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal remedies.
